abstracts.cdata!:
The overall achievement of the project
            objectives was satisfactory, and project sustainability is
            likely. Overall performance of the World Bank is
            satisfactory, as is Borrower performance. The evaluation
            provided these lessons: The two-year time frame was
            inadequate. The time frame did not fully capture the
            capabilities of the Department of Environment (DOE) and the
            Fire and Rescue Service Department (FRD) to implement a
            project of this nature. Further, both agencies were hampered
            by the lack of knowledge and experience in Bank procedures.
            This caused considerable delays in completing project
            documentation including grant agreement and its subsequent
            extensions, procurement, and special account management. in
            the case of the MAC subproject, without a proper regulatory
            framework and effective enforcement, the efforts to provide
            financial incentives, training, and other assistance had
            been found inadequate to induce investment in non-CFC
            technologies. Similarly, the Halon subproject did not
            proceed well under the management of the private operator
            who lacked regulatory authority. The government quickly
            learned this, and enacted separate legislation for
            refrigeration and halon management. The public awareness
            component helped to minimize resistance to the enactment of
            Refrigeration Management Regulation. Without adequate
            training and a financial subsidy, the service shops would
            have difficulty financing and handling non-CFC technology,
